meanings.definition: A class of drugs used to prevent and treat osteoporosis.
meanings.sent1: Doctors prescribed bisphosphonates to help with weak bones.
meanings.sent2: My grandmother takes bisphosphonates to make her bones stronger.
meanings.sent3: Why did the skeleton refuse to take bisphosphonates? It didn't want to be too hard-headed!
meanings.sent4: The bisphosphonates acted like construction workers, reinforcing the bone structure.
meanings.sent5: The image of bisphosphonates as tiny builders fortifying bones stuck in my mind.

meanings.definition: A type of medication that helps strengthen bones.
meanings.sent1: Athletes sometimes use bisphosphonates to improve bone strength.
meanings.sent2: The doctor recommended bisphosphonates to enhance my bone density.
meanings.sent3: Why did the comedian take bisphosphonates? To add some 'bone-tickling' strength to the jokes!
meanings.sent4: The bisphosphonates were like magical potions, infusing bones with newfound power.
meanings.sent5: The idea of bisphosphonates as bone-strengthening elixirs fascinated me.

meanings.sent1: The bisphosphonates slowed down the process of bone breakdown.
meanings.sent2: Patients with osteoporosis often benefit from taking bisphosphonates to stop bone loss.
meanings.sent3: Why did the skeleton take bisphosphonates before the dance? To avoid any 'bone-shaking' moves!
meanings.sent4: The bisphosphonates acted as guardians, protecting bones from being absorbed away.
meanings.sent5: The concept of bisphosphonates as bone protectors against resorption was enlightening.
